Text: 1713: En route to Wissenfels

Speaker: Narrator
Text: Meet Johann Sebastian Bach.
He is on his way to celebrate the 31st birthday of the Duke.
He had prepared an original work for this occassion, and it is a really good one...

Init: self.curr_alpha= 0; self.mask= pygame.Surface((800, 600)).convert(); self.bg_copy= self.background.copy(); self.fade_spd= 1

Text: After the celebration...

Speaker: Duke
Text: Bravo! Johann, that was splendid!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Thank you, your highness. I wish you good health and happiness.

Speaker: Duke
Text: Follow me, Johann. I think I have something that you might fancy.

Init: self.curr_alpha= 0; self.mask= pygame.Surface((800, 600)).convert(); self.bg_copy= self.background.copy(); self.fade_spd= 6

Speaker: Duke
Text: Last week, when I went hunting in the forest, I saw a huge bolt of lightning come down in the middle of a sunny day. I went to check out what the lightning had struck, and there it was - a metal harpsichord.

Speaker: Bach
Text: It's enormous!

Speaker: Duke
Text: Yes, indeed! It sounds weird too, go on, play it!

Speaker: Bach
Text: It has 88 keys! This is... amazing!

Speaker: Narrator
Text: As he played, he felt a surge of refreshing energy coursing through him, he was composing on the spot!

Init: self.curr_alpha= 0; self.mask= pygame.Surface((800, 600)).convert(); self.bg_copy= self.background.copy(); self.fade_spd= 2

Speaker: Duke
Text: Johann? Where did you go?

Speaker: Narrator
Text: Bach had his eyes closed the whole time, he was too deeply immersed in the sounds he was creating. Never realising that he was tunnelling through a wormhole... He was heading to the FUTURE!
1791: Vienna

Speaker: Bach
Text: I just had a brilliant idea... your highness?

Speaker: Bach
Text: Where am I?
From afar, he heard music like never before... soaring angelic voice that was filled with rage.

Init: self.curr_alpha= 0; self.mask= pygame.Surface((800, 600)).convert(); self.bg_copy= self.background.copy(); self.fade_spd= 2

Text: 1800: Vienna

Speaker: Bach
Text: Can I get some water please?

Speaker: Bach
Text: Thank you so much! Can you tell me where am I?

Speaker: Bartender
Text: This is Wieden, Vienna!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Vienna?!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Hey, is this a real calendar?

Speaker: Bartender
Text: If you're going to keep asking me weird questions, I suggest you better get going!

Speaker: Bach
Text: How rude!

Speaker: Bach
Text: A theatre! Wonder what music is being performed today...

Speaker: Bach
Text: That was so lovely!
1808: Vienna

Speaker: Bach
Text: I wonder what surprises await me...

Speaker: Bach
Text: I want to go home...
1828: Vienna

Speaker: Bach
Text: Hmm, a virtuoso violinist... Interesting!

Speaker: Bach
Text: He was so good! He must be the devil!
1832: Vienna

Speaker: Bach
Text: A posthumous publication of Schubert at a discount? That's a good deal to learn some new songs!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Wow, young people these days really know how to express themselves!
1839: Paris

Speaker: Baker
Text: Croissants fraichement cuits!

Speaker: Bach
Text: France? What a great surprise! I wonder what history has prepared this time...

Speaker: Bach
Text: Frédéric Chopin, now that's a name that I will not forget! He really made that piano sing!
1858: Paris

Speaker: Bach
Text: Well, I am really loving this time travel trip, but I'm feeling kind of tired hearing all these serious concerts.

Speaker: Bach
Text: Wonder if there's any comedy performances nearby...

Speaker: Lady
Text: I can't wait to watch it again tonight! It's hilarious!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Excusez-moi madame, what are you watching tonight?

Speaker: Lady
Text: Oh, it's Jacques Offenbach's new operetta, Orpheus in the Underworld! It's all the rage in town now!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Where can I get the tickets?

Speaker: Lady
Text: Come with me!

Init: self.curr_alpha= 0; self.mask= pygame.Surface((800, 600)).convert(); self.bg_copy= self.background.copy(); self.fade_spd= 1

Speaker: Bach
Text: HAHAHAHA, what a fantastic night!
1875: Paris

Speaker: Bach
Text: "...a naïve soldier who is seduced by the wiles of the fiery gypsy Carmen... another opera! Sign me up!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Well, that was RIVETING! Ugh, where is my lovely piano, I... I need MORE!
1876: Oslo, Norway

Speaker: Bach
Text: Ah, it's freezing! My head hurts...

Speaker: Bach
Text: Darn it, I changed places again! Where is this?

Speaker: Ticketboy
Text: Doors to Peer Gynt closes in 5 minutes!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Ooh, what a lavish theatre! It sure looks warm and cosy in there... Wait for me!!!

Speaker: Ticketboy
Text: Hey, you didn't pay for your ticket!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Time to get away!
1888: Paris

Speaker: Bach
Text: Phew, that was a close one!

Speaker: Servant
Text: Monsieur, are you here for the concert?

Speaker: Bach
Text: Concert? Oh, yes, concert.

Speaker: Servant
Text: Kindly follow me.
1916: Moscow

Speaker: Bach
Text: Oh boy, can it get any colder!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Great music! But TERRIBLE WEATHER!!!
1957: New York City

Speaker: Bach
Text: Uh... where is this place?

Speaker: Bach
Text: Are those magical carriages?

Speaker: Dude
Text: Hey, cool piano dude!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Dude? What's a dude? Where am I?

Speaker: Dude
Text: It's Broadway, baby! The cultural capital of the world!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Well, I guess I could always learn more by watching some of their theatre!

Speaker: Bach
Text: The people here are so barbaric, how can this place be the cultural capital?
1960: Somewhere in America

Speaker: Bach
Text: Hey... excuse me. Can you tell me where is the band playing?

Speaker: Girl
Text: What band?

Speaker: Bach
Text: The band that is playing right now, you can hear them!

Speaker: Girl
Text: Oh... haha, that's a recording! The band is not actually here.

Speaker: Bach
Text: Recording? What's that?

Speaker: Girl
Text: You can store music inside these discs these days, surely you must have heard of vinyl-

Speaker: Bach
Text: Vinyl? So you just put them on that machine and sound comes out magically?

Speaker: Girl
Text: Yep! Just like magic!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Ok, I think I've had enough of this... jazz business. I want to go home.
1713: Back at the Palace

Speaker: Duke
Text: Good God! Johann! Where did you come from?

Speaker: Bach
Text: Uh...

Speaker: Duke
Text: Your clothes are filthy! There are guests out there, don't make a fool of yourself!

Speaker: Bach
Text: Uh...

Speaker: Duke
Text: Servants, get Herr Bach here some clothes now!
